com.wookler.server.common

Class TaskManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wookler.server.common.TaskManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Configurable, Runnable

    public class TaskManager
extends Object
implements Configurable, Runnable
    Task manager is responsible for scheduling/monitoring registered managed tasks. The task manager uses a executor thread pool of a configured size to schedule tasks.
    Author:
    Subho Ghosh (subho dot ghosh at outlook.com)

        public TaskManager()

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(ConfigNode config)
               throws ConfigurationException
        Configure this instance of the task manager. Sample: 
         
     <task-manager>
         <params>
             <param name="executor.pool.size" value="[VALUE] />
         </params>
     </task-manager>
        Specified by:
        configure in interface Configurable
        Parameters:
        config - - Configuration node for this instance.
        Throws:
        ConfigurationException

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Dispose this instance of the task manager.
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Configurable

      • run

        public void run()
        Thread runnable function - this will loop thru the registered tasks and if execution is due will schedule the same to the executor pool. This function will also check for the completed task status and execute the task callback to handle the status.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • addtask

        public String addtask(ManagedTask task)
               throws Task.TaskException
        Register a new managed task with this manager.
        Parameters:
        task - - Managed task to register.
        Returns:
        - Task ID of the registered task instance.
        Throws:
        Task.TaskException

      • start

        public void start()
           throws Task.TaskException
        Start the Task Manager. This will create a new instance of a Monitored thread and create the execution.
        Throws:
        Task.TaskException

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        IMPORTANT : This function is explicitly provided only for running tests and *SHOULD NOT* be used anywhere in the normal execution flow. It interrupts all the threads that are launched by this class. This is required since the task manager is started by the singleton Env. Without this, running the tests individually succeeds. However, when all tests are executed in the context of same jvm (mvn clean install), it corrupts the thread context.
